It can be made during and after completion of The Fremennik Isles quest with level 56 Woodcutting on the woodcutting stump near the bank in Neitiznot. This article is about the shield made during The Fremennik Isles. For the shield worn by Fremenniks, see Fremennik shield.
Neitiznot shield

Item ID10826

The Neitiznot shield, also commonly called the Fremennik roundshield, is a shield made of wood that requires level 25 Defence to wield. It can be made during and after completion of The Fremennik Isles quest with level 56 Woodcutting on the woodcutting stump near the bank in Neitiznot. This requires two arctic pine logs, a bronze nail, a rope, and a hammer in the inventory. Making the shield grants 34 Crafting experience.

Although this shield can only be created after reaching a certain point in The Fremennik Isles quest, it is not a wielding requirement, and it can be worn by players who have not started the quest.

It has a slightly higher ranged and crush defence compared to the adamant kiteshield, but much lower slash and stab defence. It also lowers ranged attack and magic attack more than the adamant kiteshield. Therefore, it is not commonly used by players with 30 or higher Defence. It is, however, a safe alternative to players who have 25 Defence, as its defensive stats are comparably higher than those of the mithril kiteshield.

This shield also reduces the maximum damage taken from the ice troll females' and thrower trolls' throwing rock attacks from 6 to 2.[1]

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
2 October 2019
(update)

The item's name was changed from "Fremennik shield" to "Neitiznot shield".

Trivia[edit | edit source]

Some of the mercenaries guarding the Desert Mining Camp can be seen wielding shields that look identical to the Neitiznot shield.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 29 October 2020. (Archived from the original on 29 October 2020.) Mod Ash: "Changes the damage roll from 0-6 to 0-2 for trolls' rock-throwing attacks, yes. That's the females, the thrower trolls and the ones encountered in a quest-specific battle area during the Fremennik Isles quest."
